name: Enchilada Bubble Up Casserole
description: If you love bubble up casseroles but don’t love canned biscuits, you’ve got to try this from-scratch Enchilada Bubble Up Casserole.
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp active dry or instant yeast ($0.09)
1.5 cups all-purpose flour (plus some for dusting) ($0.06)
2 cups cooked chicken, shredded or chopped** ($1.75)

recipeInstructions.text: Begin the biscuit dough first, so it can rest for one hour. Dissolve the yeast into 1/4 cup hot water. Let that sit for a few minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Begin the biscuit dough first, so it can rest for one hour. Dissolve the yeast into 1/4 cup hot water. Let that sit for a few minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, stir together the all-purpose flour, salt, baking powder, and sugar. Finally, add the heavy cream and yeast water, and stir until a sticky ball of dough forms.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, stir together the all-purpose flour, salt, baking powder, and sugar. Finally, add the heavy cream and yeast water, and stir until a sticky ball of dough forms.

recipeInstructions.text: Dust the sticky dough with flour and then turn it out onto a well floured surface. Knead the dough for about three minutes, adding flour as you go to keep it from sticking. Form the dough into a ball, place it back in the bowl, cover it loosely with plastic, and let it rest for one hour.
recipeInstructions.name: Dust the sticky dough with flour and then turn it out onto a well floured surface. Knead the dough for about three minutes, adding flour as you go to keep it from sticking. Form the dough into a ball, place it back in the bowl, cover it loosely with plastic, and let it rest for one hour.

recipeInstructions.text: In the mean time, make the enchilada sauce. Add the oil, flour, and chili powder to a small sauce pot. Whisk the ingredients together and place over a medium burner. Allow the mixture to begin to sizzle and bubble, and continue to cook and whisk for about one minute.
recipeInstructions.name: In the mean time, make the enchilada sauce. Add the oil, flour, and chili powder to a small sauce pot. Whisk the ingredients together and place over a medium burner. Allow the mixture to begin to sizzle and bubble, and continue to cook and whisk for about one minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Carefully whisk in the water, tomato paste, cumin, garlic powder, and cayenne pepper. Allow the mixture to come up to a simmer again, at which point it will thicken. Remove it from the heat and add salt to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Carefully whisk in the water, tomato paste, cumin, garlic powder, and cayenne pepper. Allow the mixture to come up to a simmer again, at which point it will thicken. Remove it from the heat and add salt to taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the black beans and add them to a bowl along with the cooked chicken. Add the enchilada sauce and stir them together until everything is coated.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain the black beans and add them to a bowl along with the cooked chicken. Add the enchilada sauce and stir them together until everything is coated.

recipeInstructions.text: After the dough has been resting for one hour, begin to preheat the oven to 375ºF. Coat an 8x11" or 2 quart casserole dish with non-stick spray.
recipeInstructions.name: After the dough has been resting for one hour, begin to preheat the oven to 375ºF. Coat an 8x11" or 2 quart casserole dish with non-stick spray.

recipeInstructions.text: Take the dough out of the bowl and place it on a well floured surface. Press it down into a circle or rectangle, and then cut it into small, bite-sized pieces. Add the pieces to the bowl with the chicken, beans, and enchilada sauce, and carefully fold them together until evenly combined and coated in sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Take the dough out of the bowl and place it on a well floured surface. Press it down into a circle or rectangle, and then cut it into small, bite-sized pieces. Add the pieces to the bowl with the chicken, beans, and enchilada sauce, and carefully fold them together until evenly combined and coated in sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread the dough mixture into the casserole dish and make sure it's in an even layer across the bottom. The mixture should not be piled too thick. Cover the dish with foil and bake for 20 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for 10-15 minutes more, or until the center is baked through.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread the dough mixture into the casserole dish and make sure it's in an even layer across the bottom. The mixture should not be piled too thick. Cover the dish with foil and bake for 20 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for 10-15 minutes more, or until the center is baked through.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the shredded cheese, and bake for another 5-7 minutes. Top with sliced green onions just before serving.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the shredded cheese, and bake for another 5-7 minutes. Top with sliced green onions just before serving.

review.reviewBody: I made this and I have always had bad luck with making bread, and this was no exception. I made this and I must have not understood when it was done because the top biscuits seemed fine, but the bread was uncooked in the middle of the dish, may have been better if I used a different cookware. Otherwise my partner loved this as this dish contains the things he loves. So it is good I would make it again with some modifications on my end. I really liked it included homemade enchilada sauce it was fun to make.
The feedback from my husband was that it seemed like a lot of work for me and that the bread bits didn't have much taste. The same ingredients would have tasted better if served with tortilla crips.

Our household really enjoyed this recipe as comfort food. This is also a very dynamic recipe, as it can be used to make enchilada pizza by rolling out the biscuit dough into a crust, adding sauce,  Monterey Jack cheese, and bits of chicken. The only real changes I made were adding a tsp(ish) of unsweetened cocoa powder to the sauce as well as an equal amount of sugar. Over all, this recipe was a wonderful foundation for many dishes to come. Thanks for the inspiration!

Pretty good! I substituted store bought biscuit dough due to stress and budget constraints and some of them were kind of runny. Might be caused by not cooking long enough but shouldn't be anything  a little extra time in the oven won't fix.
This was AWESOME!!!! I recommend keeping a little extra enchilada sauce to pour over the leftovers before reheating. Everyone was asking what I had brought for lunch and wanted some :)

This was a great dish! My only issues were that my enchilada sauce did not thicken even though I followed the recipe for it and directions exactly. To fix this I mixed flour and water in a separate bowl until smooth and stirred it into the sauce while it was over heat until I got the desired thickness. This worked really well. I will be making this again! My tweak was I added a tablespoon of sour cream to the sauce mixture after it was mixed with the beans and chicken. Yummy!
Wow! Just made this meal and it was delicious! Not hard to make either!
